levels.title: Foundations
levels.subtitle: The atomic units of intelligence
levels.description: Master the underlying mechanics of large language models before progressing through the fluency levels. Understand tokens, context windows, probabilistic prediction, and the mathematical foundations that sustain AI — linear algebra, calculus, probability, and optimization theory.

levels.title: Casual Consumer
levels.subtitle: From magic box to inference engine
levels.description: Develop intuition for AI capabilities through direct interaction with web-based interfaces. Transition from viewing AI as a magic box to understanding it as an inference engine that predicts responses from training knowledge. Learn inference versus training, probabilistic outputs, and basic prompting for summarization, drafting, and brainstorming.

levels.title: Prompt Engineer
levels.subtitle: Precise instructional design for AI
levels.description: Move from casual conversation to precise instructional design. Master advanced prompting techniques including zero-shot, few-shot in-context learning, chain-of-thought reasoning, and role simulation. Control model behavior through temperature, system messages, and delimiters. Employ controlled hallucination and recursive self-improvement strategies.

levels.title: Context Engineer
levels.subtitle: Grounding AI in external data
levels.description: Move beyond the model's internal weights to include external, proprietary data. Specialize in grounding AI through Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), vector databases, and embedding pipelines. Master the full lifecycle of document processing — ingestion, chunking, indexing, and retrieval — to ensure factual accuracy and domain relevance.

levels.title: AI Component Engineer
levels.subtitle: AI as a modular software component
levels.description: Treat AI as a modular component within broader software architecture. Bridge conventional software engineering with the unique nature of AI models using AI Systems Engineering Patterns. Master async parallelism, deterministic wrappers, context engineering, vectorize integration, CI/CD for models, and fallback strategies between frontier and local models.

levels.title: AI System Engineer
levels.subtitle: Orchestrating complex agentic workflows
levels.description: Orchestrate complex, multi-stage agentic workflows. Understand the deep architecture of transformers — self-attention mechanisms, multi-head attention, and parallel processing. Master fine-tuning and domain adaptation for specialized industries. Evaluate system reliability through LLM-as-a-judge, perplexity metrics, and adversarial robustness testing.

levels.title: AI Platformizer
levels.subtitle: Scaling AI across the enterprise
levels.description: Focus on infrastructure and governance required to scale AI organization-wide. Standardize the AI Stack for secure, efficient team usage. Manage MLOps including inference serving, LoRA/QLoRA optimization, monitoring, drift detection, and cost management. Bridge technical teams and executive leadership through strategic adoption, governance frameworks, and compliance with regulations like the EU AI Act.

levels.title: AI Pioneer
levels.subtitle: Pushing the boundaries of the field
levels.description: Push the boundaries of AI through fundamental research and innovation. Focus on long-term societal impacts including AI alignment, emergent behavior detection, and AIGC ethics. Engage with frontier research through institutions like the Vector Institute, contribute to NeurIPS and CVPR proceedings, and address challenges of deepfakes, misinformation, and preserving human creativity.

root.title: AI Fluency
root.description: Master AI fluency through evidence-based learning — from foundational concepts to pioneering research.

root.title: Glossary
root.description: Key AI terms and definitions used throughout the AI Fluency curriculum.

root.title: Getting Started
root.description: How to use the AI Fluency platform, understand the learning structure, and choose your path.

root.title: Competency Map
root.description: The 4D competency framework that guides your AI fluency journey across all seven levels.

resources.title: Resource Library
resources.description: Curated books, courses, videos, podcasts, and newsletters for every level of AI fluency.

resources.title: Books
resources.description: Essential books for AI fluency, from intuitive introductions to dense academic treatments.

resources.title: Courses
resources.description: Structured online courses and professional programs for building AI fluency.

resources.title: Videos
resources.description: YouTube channels and video series for learning AI through visual, engaging content.

resources.title: Podcasts
resources.description: AI podcasts for practitioners, covering research, engineering, business strategy, and the future of AI.

resources.title: Newsletters
resources.description: AI newsletters and blogs to stay current with the rapidly evolving field.

level-7.title: Level 7: AI Pioneer
level-7.description: Pushing the boundaries of AI through alignment research, emergent behavior analysis, ethics, and frontier innovation.

level-7.title: 7.1: Alignment and Safety
level-7.description: Understand AI alignment challenges, RLHF, constitutional AI, and the foundations of AI safety research.

level-7.title: 7.2: Emergent Behavior
level-7.description: Explore emergent capabilities, scaling laws, and phase transitions in large AI systems.

level-7.title: 7.3: Ethics of AI Content
level-7.description: Navigate the ethical challenges of deepfakes, AI-generated art, attribution, creative rights, and societal impact.

level-7.title: 7.4: Frontier Research
level-7.description: Explore the cutting edge of AI research: open problems, research methodology, and future directions.

level-7.title: 7.5 Designing Training Objectives
level-7.description: Explore how loss function design, contrastive learning, and reward modeling shape model behavior.

level-7.title: 7.7: Level 7 Checkpoint
level-7.description: Assess your understanding of AI's frontier challenges in alignment, emergence, ethics, and research.

level-7.title: 7.6 Architecture Innovation
level-7.description: Survey novel architectural approaches beyond standard transformers, from state space models to advanced optimization.

level-6.title: Level 6: AI Platformizer
level-6.description: Scaling AI across the organization with production infrastructure, governance, and cost management.

level-6.title: 6.1: MLOps Fundamentals
level-6.description: Master the ML lifecycle, experiment tracking, and model registry for production AI systems.

level-6.title: 6.2: Inference Serving
level-6.description: Optimize model inference with quantization, batching, caching, and serving architecture patterns.

level-6.title: 6.3: Monitoring and Drift
level-6.description: Detect and respond to model degradation through monitoring, data drift detection, and concept drift analysis.

level-6.title: 6.4: Governance and Compliance
level-6.description: Establish AI governance frameworks, risk management processes, and regulatory compliance for enterprise AI.

level-6.title: 6.5: Cost Management
level-6.description: Master token economics, compute optimization, and cost modeling for sustainable AI operations.

level-6.title: 6.6: Distributed Computing for AI
level-6.description: Understand data, tensor, and pipeline parallelism strategies for scaling AI inference and training across hardware.

level-6.title: 6.7: Sovereignty and Data Residency
level-6.description: Navigate geopolitical constraints on AI deployment including data residency laws, export controls, and multi-region architecture.

level-6.title: 6.8: Level 6 Checkpoint
level-6.description: Assess your readiness as an AI Platformizer with this comprehensive checkpoint.

level-5.title: Level 5: AI System Engineer
level-5.description: Understanding AI from the inside out -- transformer architecture, fine-tuning, evaluation, and agentic workflows -- then designing multi-component AI systems.

level-5.title: 5.1 Transformer Architecture
level-5.description: Understanding the encoder-decoder structure, self-attention, and positional encoding that power modern AI.

level-5.title: 5.2 Attention Mechanism
level-5.description: Deep dive into Query, Key, Value vectors, multi-head attention, and how models decide what to focus on.

level-5.title: 5.3 Fine-Tuning
level-5.description: LoRA, QLoRA, RLHF, and domain adaptation techniques for customizing models to specialized tasks.

level-5.title: 5.4 Evaluation Metrics
level-5.description: BLEU, ROUGE, perplexity, human evaluation, and building rigorous benchmark suites for AI systems.

level-5.title: 5.5 Agentic Workflows
level-5.description: ReAct prompting, tool use, multi-agent systems, and orchestration patterns for autonomous AI.

level-5.title: 5.6 Tool Protocols and MCP
level-5.description: How agents discover and use tools through standardized protocols, from function calling to the Model Context Protocol.

level-5.title: 5.7 Subagents and Delegation
level-5.description: Spawning specialized agents for parallel work with isolated context, typed capabilities, and structured delegation.

level-5.title: 5.8 Multi-Agent Teams
level-5.description: Coordinating multiple agents on shared objectives with task lists, message passing, and graceful lifecycle management.

level-5.title: 5.9 Building Custom Agents
level-5.description: Building agents programmatically with SDKs — from tool definitions to deployment and testing strategies.

level-5.title: 5.10 Orchestration Frameworks
level-5.description: Compare AI workflow frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, CrewAI, and n8n for building multi-step AI systems.

level-5.title: 5.11 Human-in-the-Loop Design
level-5.description: Design effective human oversight into AI systems with confidence-based routing and escalation thresholds.

level-5.title: 5.12 Multi-AI System Architecture
level-5.description: Design systems with specialist, router, and evaluator models that work together with defined reliability targets.

level-5.title: 5.13 System-Level Cost and Performance
level-5.description: Manage inference costs and performance across multi-model pipelines with token budgets and batch optimization.

level-5.title: 5.14 Checkpoint: AI System Engineer
level-5.description: Assess your Level 5 understanding of AI system engineering.

level-4.title: 4.5 Testing & CI/CD
level-4.description: Creating evaluation suites, snapshot tests, and CI/CD pipelines for AI components.

level-4.title: Level 4: AI Component Engineer
level-4.description: Engineering reliable AI components within production software systems.

level-4.title: 4.2 Engineering Patterns for AI
level-4.description: Applying proven software engineering and SRE patterns to build robust AI-powered systems.

level-4.title: 4.4 Deterministic Wrappers
level-4.description: Building layers around probabilistic AI outputs to enforce structured formats and ensure reliability.

level-4.title: 4.6 Context Compression Patterns
level-4.description: Implement engineering patterns for context compression including summarization pipelines, sliding windows, and token budget managers.

level-4.title: 4.8 Checkpoint: AI Component Engineer
level-4.description: Assess your Level 4 understanding of AI component engineering.

level-4.title: 4.7 Can vs. Should: AI Decision Frameworks
level-4.description: Evaluate when AI is the right solution versus traditional algorithms, considering complexity, cost, and determinism tradeoffs.

level-4.title: 4.3 API Integration
level-4.description: Working with AI provider APIs including authentication, SDKs, rate limiting, and error handling.

level-4.title: 4.1 AI as Software Component
level-4.description: Treating AI models as components with defined interfaces, contracts, and failure modes.

level-3.title: Level 3: The Context Engineer
level-3.description: Move beyond the model's internal knowledge. Learn to ground AI in external data using embeddings, vector databases, and RAG.

level-3.title: 3.1 Embeddings and Vector Space
level-3.description: Understand how AI represents text as mathematical vectors that capture semantic meaning, enabling similarity search.

level-3.title: 3.2 Vector Databases
level-3.description: Learn how vector databases store embeddings and perform millisecond-speed similarity searches using algorithms like HNSW.

level-3.title: 3.3 The RAG Pipeline
level-3.description: Understand the Retrieval-Augmented Generation architecture that connects external data to language models.

level-3.title: 3.4 Chunking and Retrieval
level-3.description: Learn how document chunking strategies affect retrieval quality and how to optimize for the right information reaching the model.

level-3.title: 3.5 Grounding for Accuracy
level-3.description: Learn techniques to reduce hallucination and increase factual accuracy by grounding AI responses in retrieved evidence.

level-3.title: 3.6 Model Architecture Awareness
level-3.description: Understand how Mixture of Experts, Mixture of Agents, and reasoning models affect context engineering decisions.

level-3.title: 3.7 Model Economics and ROI
level-3.description: Calculate the true cost of AI approaches by comparing token pricing, latency tradeoffs, and ROI across strategies.

level-3.title: 3.8 Context Compression
level-3.description: Learn when and how to compress context to stay within token budgets while preserving answer quality.

level-3.title: 3.9 Level 3 Checkpoint
level-3.description: Design and evaluate a complete RAG system from memory. Test your understanding of embeddings, retrieval, and grounding.

level-2.title: Level 2: The Prompt Engineer
level-2.description: Move from casual conversation to precise instructional design. Learn advanced prompting techniques that maximize AI output quality.

level-2.title: 2.1 Zero-Shot and Few-Shot Prompting
level-2.description: Learn how providing examples in your prompt teaches the model to follow patterns it was never explicitly trained on.

level-2.title: 2.2 Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
level-2.description: Learn how forcing the model to reason step by step dramatically improves performance on complex tasks.

level-2.title: 2.3 Roles and Personas
level-2.description: Learn how assigning the model a specific identity shapes its tone, knowledge depth, and reasoning perspective.

level-2.title: 2.4 Parameters and Control
level-2.description: Master the technical parameters that control model behavior: temperature, top-p, max tokens, and structural delimiters.

level-2.title: 2.5 Recursive Self-Improvement
level-2.description: Learn how to have the model critique, refine, and iteratively improve its own outputs for higher-quality results.

level-2.title: 2.6 Prompt Libraries and Personal Optimization
level-2.description: Build and organize a personal prompt toolkit for consistent, high-quality AI interactions.

level-2.title: 2.7 Local Models and Privacy
level-2.description: Run AI models locally for privacy, cost control, and offline access using tools like Ollama and LM Studio.

level-2.title: 2.8 Structured Output Basics
level-2.description: Learn to request JSON, CSV, and structured formats from AI models through prompt techniques.

level-2.title: 2.9 Introduction to Agentic Loops
level-2.description: Understand the think-act-observe loop that enables AI to use tools and take actions.

level-2.title: 2.10 Level 2 Checkpoint
level-2.description: Test your prompt engineering skills. Apply zero-shot, few-shot, chain-of-thought, roles, and self-improvement techniques from memory.

level-1.title: Level 1: The Casual Consumer
level-1.description: Begin your AI fluency journey by understanding what AI actually does when you talk to it.

level-1.title: 1.1 AI as an Inference Engine
level-1.description: Understand the difference between training and inference, and why AI models do not learn from your conversations.

level-1.title: 1.2 The Probabilistic Nature of AI
level-1.description: Learn why AI gives different answers to the same question, and how temperature and sampling control randomness.

level-1.title: 1.3 Basic Prompting Patterns
level-1.description: Learn the three foundational prompting patterns -- summarize, draft, and brainstorm -- that form your first AI toolkit.

level-1.title: 1.4 Choosing the Right Model
level-1.description: Understand the landscape of AI models -- GPT-4, Claude, Gemini, and open-source alternatives -- and learn when to use which.

level-1.title: 1.5 AI Is Not Thinking
level-1.description: Understand why AI fluent text feels authoritative but represents pattern matching, not cognition.

level-1.title: 1.6 When Not to Trust AI
level-1.description: Learn to identify high-risk domains where AI outputs require mandatory human verification.

level-1.title: 1.7 Level 1 Checkpoint
level-1.description: Test your understanding of Level 1 concepts without AI assistance. Recall, explain, and apply.

foundations.title: Foundations
foundations.description: The atomic units of intelligence — master the core concepts and mathematical pillars that sustain modern AI.

foundations.title: F.1: Tokens and the Architecture of Language
foundations.description: How large language models break down human language into computable units, and why tokenization affects cost, performance, and multilingual AI applications.

foundations.title: F.2: Context Windows as AI's Working Memory
foundations.description: Understanding the limited memory that shapes every AI interaction, and how to manage it effectively for better results.

foundations.title: F.3: Probabilistic Thinking for AI
foundations.description: Why AI outputs are predictions based on probabilities, not factual lookups, and how to calibrate your expectations accordingly.

foundations.title: F.4: Linear Algebra for AI
foundations.description: Vectors, matrices, and transformations — the mathematical language of data representation in AI systems.

foundations.title: F.5: Calculus for AI
foundations.description: Derivatives, gradients, and backpropagation — the mathematics of how neural networks learn from their mistakes.

foundations.title: F.6: Probability and Statistics for AI
foundations.description: Probability distributions, Bayes' theorem, and statistical inference — the mathematics of decision-making under uncertainty.

foundations.title: F.7: Optimization for AI
foundations.description: Gradient descent, loss functions, and optimization landscapes — finding the best parameters in a vast search space.
